Package data

Class TMPGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.TMPGenerator
  • public class TMPGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The TMPGenerator can generate new, cohesive data for the TMPDatabase.

        public void setPortNameFile​(java.lang.String path)
        Set the file to use for Port names.

      • setGlobality

        public void setGlobality​(int amount)
        Set how interconnected the Ports are on a scale of 1 to 10. Lower the value, the fewer Routes there are between Ports. There will never be a stranded Port (a Port with no way in) or a dead end (a Port with no way back to a previous Port).

      • setTravelCosts

        public void setTravelCosts​(int amount)
        Set how easy it is to use Routes on a scale of 1 to 10. Higher the value, more it costs to use a Route.

      • setIndustry

        public void setIndustry​(int amount)
        Set how many Commodities Ports are willing to trade on a scale of 1 to 10. Lower value = less Commodities.

      • setStartingProfit

        public void setStartingProfit​(int amount)
        Sets a Merchant's starting profit, determining capacity and number of starting Commodities. (1..10)

      • setVerbose

        public void setVerbose​(boolean v)
        Sets whether or not to print out Generator details.

        Generates several commodities and stores them in the database.

      • generatePorts

        public void generatePorts()
        Generates several commodities and stores them in the database.
        See Also:
        setCommodityNameFile(String)

      • generatePortInventories

        public void generatePortInventories()
        PortInventories are assigned to Ports and contain availability and price. The number of PortInventories per Port is determined by the "industry" variable. The availability of a Commodity is based on its value (lower values and higher wealths mean more availability). Commodity prices are based on wealth, value.

      • generateRoutes

        public void generateRoutes()
        Routes connect Ports together. The number of Routes is determined be the globality variable. The higher the value, the more Routes that exist. For every Route into a Port, there is a respective Route back, to prevent dead ends. However, these may not have the same costs. The algorithm used to generate these Routes is a bastardized insertion sort. Two Port Lists are generated. The first List, called visited, begins with a single Port (the first one in the list). The other List, unvisited, holds all the other Ports. Randomly select Ports in the unvisited List. Once selected, create a Route between that Port, the last Port in the visited List. Then, create a different Route with a random Port in the visited List. Finally, move the unvisited Port into the visited List. Repeat until all Ports have been visited. Finally, randomly place Routes between the Ports (don't create duplicates), until a satisfactory number have been created. A minimum number of Routes will always be created in order to bi-directionally connect every single Port.

      • generateRouteCosts

        public void generateRouteCosts()
        Generate RouteCosts for each Route. RouteCosts are based on several factors. First and foremost, the travelCost variable will determine how many Commodities are required. At 1, that number is 1, at 5, it's between 1 and 3, and at 10 it's between 4 and 6. The amount required is based on the wealth of destination Port. Wealthier Port, higher cost. Finally, the commodity required is always selected from one of the Commodities carried by the starting port. This is to prevent nearly-unavoidable "game-overs" but traveling to a Port without enough of some certain Commodity in stock. Additionally, the amount required will never be greater than the amount originally carried by the Port. This is to allow first- timers a way out, before they know what they need to leave.

      • generateMerchant

        public Merchant generateMerchant​(java.lang.String name)
        Generates a new Merchant. Generates a single Voyage for the Merchant's home port.

      • generateWorld

        public void generateWorld()
        Resets and generates an entire database, based on the given components.
